wiki.summary: Helped by a piano sample taken from Nas' Mafioso-rap classic “Affirmative Action,” Drake claims “Mob Ties” and severs links with people who have betrayed him. Some of Drake’s OVO associates with criminal pasts include Baka Not Nice and the late Anthony “Fif” Soares. He also has a close relationship with Rap-a-Lot Records founder J. Prince, who was the subject of a 12-year criminal investigation by the DEA. Drake posted the following picture with the aforementioned J. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Helped by a piano sample taken from Nas' Mafioso-rap classic “Affirmative Action,” Drake claims “Mob Ties” and severs links with people who have betrayed him. Some of Drake’s OVO associates with criminal pasts include Baka Not Nice and the late Anthony “Fif” Soares. He also has a close relationship with Rap-a-Lot Records founder J. Prince, who was the subject of a 12-year criminal investigation by the DEA. Drake posted the following picture with the aforementioned J. Prince and his affiliates on Instagram on July 5, 2018 with the caption “Ties👔”. The song seemed to originally feature Travis Scott, hinted in an Instagram post by La Flame himself from back in November 2017. On May 28, 2024 a reference track for this song sang by Vory was leaked to the public which sparked controversy on Drake's songwriting skills. “Mob Ties” debuted at #13 on the Billboard Hot 100 on the chart week of July 14, 2018. It stayed on the chart for eight weeks before departing. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
